Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
class stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >

This class template implements a Dummy Tree. The Dummy Tree has the same external interface and behavior of a Metric Tree but is implemented as sequential list.

It can perform both range and k-nearest neighbout queries but without the performance associated with other structures. Its algorithms always have O(N) (except for insertion which is O(1)). In other words, it will take a lot of time to give answers but it will assure their correctness.

This class was developed to generate perfect answers to queries. It allows the build of automated test programs for other metric trees implemented by this library.

Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

Todo:
Finish the implementation.

Compute statistics.

Version:
1.0

Definition at line 141 of file stDummyTree.h.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
virtual tResult* stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::KAndRangeQuery (  tObject *  sample,
stDistance  range,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false
)  [virtual]
 

This method will perform a range query with a limited number of results.

This query is a combination of the standard range query and the standard k-nearest neighbour query. All objects which matches both conditions will be included in the result.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
range The range of the results.
k The maximum number of results.
tie The tie list. This parameter is optional. Default false;
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

Reimplemented from stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
virtual tResult* stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::KOrRangeQuery (  tObject *  sample,
stDistance  range,
stCount  k,
bool  tie = false
)  [virtual]
 

This method will perform range query with a limited number of results.

This query is a combination of the standard range query and the standard k-nearest neighbour query. All objects which matches with one of two conditions will be included in the result.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
range The range of the results.
k The maximum number of results.
tie The tie list. This parameter is optional. Default false;
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
virtual tResult* stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::ReversedRangeQuery (  tObject *  sample,
stDistance  range
)  [virtual]
 

This method will perform a reverse range query. The result will be a set of pairs object/distance.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
range The range of the results. All object that are greater than the range distance will be included in the result set.
Returns:
The result or NULL if this method is not implemented.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

template<class ObjectType, class EvaluatorType>
virtual tResult* stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::RingQuery (  tObject *  sample,
stDistance  inRange,
stDistance  outRange
)  [virtual]
 

This method will perform a ring query. The result will be a set of pairs object/distance.

The object pointed by sample will not be destroyed by this method.

Parameters:
sample The sample object.
inRange The inner range of the results.
outRange The outter range of the results.
Returns:
The result.
Warning:
The instance of tResult returned must be destroied by user.

The inRange must be less than the outRange.

Exceptions:
unsupported_method_error If this method is not supported by this tree.

Reimplemented from stMetricAccessMethod< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >.
